questions.question: What caused France to go deeply into debt in the 1780's?

choices.answer: France's aid to the colonists during the American Revolution
France's explorations in the New World, encouraged by Louis.
King Louis' unwillingness to tax peasants.
France's aid to the colonists during the French & Indian War

questions.question: By 1789, what caused French peasants to become angry to the point of rebellion?

choices.answer: King Louis XVI's marriage to Marie Antoinette
France's support of US over Britain in the Revolutionary War
Britain's invasion of France and Louis' inability to stop it

questions.question: What event officially started the French Revolution? (July 14, 1789)

choices.answer: The death of King Louis XVI via guillotine.
The death of Marie Antoinette via guillotine.
The invasion of the Austrians and Prussians into Paris
The storming of the Bastille Prison by peasants.

questions.question: The National Assembly of France published a document called _____. This gave the French rights.

choices.answer: The Declaration of the Rights of Man
The Constitution of the French Republic

questions.question: The _____ were radical, violent revolutionaries who called for a republic in France.
During the French Revolution, who was the leader of the Committee of Public Safety?
For a year, Maximilien Robespierre governed France as a dictator. What was his rule known as?
What was Maximilien Robespierre's goal during his rule of France (1793--1794)?

choices.answer: To build a "republic of peace" and remove the death penalty
To transform France into a stable, constitutional monarchy
To find "enemies of the revolution" and have them executed
To re-build France on the foundation of Christianity

questions.question: Approximately __ people were executed via guillotine during the Terror in France, including ___
In 1799, who declared the French Revolution to be officially over, 10 years after it had begun?
What was Napoleon's FIRST goal in restoring order and prosperity to France?

choices.answer: To invade Spain in re-claim what was rightfully French land.
To re-appoint Jacobins to power, because they were efficient
To create a strong police department within Paris.
To stabilize France's economy, which was in a depression

questions.question: What was the Napoleonic Code?

choices.answer: The code of chivalry that Napoleon brought back to France.
Comprehensive system of laws that re-established legal order
A secret message that Napoleon sent to the pope to decipher.
Economic system that restored financial prosperity to France

questions.question: In 1804, Napoleon made himself Emperor of France. Who placed the crown on his head?
Once Napoleon became Emperor of France, what was his next goal?

choices.answer: To industrialize France and enact a policy of isolationism.
To control the New World, including Central & South America.
To control the United States, his former ally.
To control the rest of Europe.

questions.question: Napoleon won almost every battle. But he lost _____ to the British navy off the coast of Spain.
In 1806, Napoleon conquered ______, and it dissolved after having existed for over 1,000 years.
Napoleon was born on the island of __________ and he died on the island of _____________.
All of these were goals of the Congress of Vienna EXCEPT...

choices.answer: to develop a plan to drive the Ottoman Turks out of Europe
to re-draw the boundaries of countries in Europe
to settle issues from the French Rev and the Napoleonic Wars
to provide a long-term peace plan in Europe

questions.question: In 1815, Napoleon escaped the island of ______. Then, he was defeated at the Battle of _______.
Who led the British fleet that defeated Napoleon's navy at the Battle of Trafalgar?
All of these men were leaders of France in the 1800's after Napoleon EXCEPT...
When Napoleon was removed from power in 1815, what type of government took his place in France?
Russia practiced ____: feudalism where peasants were bound to the nobles whose land they worked
All of these changes were made in Russia during the 1800's EXCEPT...

choices.answer: Russia became a republic & executed their former czar (1871)
Industrial development advanced & Russia's power grew (1881)
Construction of the Trans-Siberian Railroad began (1891)

questions.question: Haiti broke free from __. Mexico & most of Central and South America from __. & Brazil from __.
All these rights/protections are given to U.S. citizens accused of crimes in the 5th Amd EXCEPT

choices.answer: the right to a Grand Jury and Due Process

questions.question: George Washington was the 1st President of the US. _____ was 2nd. _____ was 3rd. _____ was 4th.

choices.answer: John Adams; Thomas Jefferson; James Madison
Thomas Jefferson; John Adams; James Madison
James Madison; Thomas Jefferson; John Adams
John Adams; James Madison; Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: __________ is "The Father of Our Country", and ___________ is "The Father of the Constitution."
All of these were causes of The War of 1812 between Britain and America EXCEPT...

choices.answer: The US wanted to take over Canada, which Britain controlled.
Britain was trying to control America by taxing U.S. ships
Britain was engaging in "impressment" of American sailors.
Lewis and Clark killed a group of innocent British explorers

questions.question: Which of these was NOT a major battle of The War of 1812?
